alert.note: Alert for Collier; Mainland Monroe (Florida) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Advisory issued May 22 at 7:21PM EDT by NWS Miami
info.description: ...FLOOD ADVISORY IN EFFECT UNTIL 930 PM EDT THIS EVENING... * WHAT...Flooding caused by excessive rainfall is expected. * WHERE...Portions of Florida and southwest Florida, including the following counties, in Florida, Mainland Monroe. In southwest Florida, Collier. * WHEN...Until 930 PM EDT. * IMPACTS...Minor flooding in low-lying and poor drainage areas. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 719 PM EDT, Doppler radar indicated heavy rain due to slow moving thunderstorms. Minor flooding is ongoing or expected to begin shortly in the advisory area. Between 2 and 4 inches of rain have fallen during the last couple of hours from these slow moving thunderstorms. - Additional rainfall amounts of 1 to 2 inches are expected over the area during the next hour or so with these slow moving thunderstorms. If the rainfall amounts increase more than forecast, then a Flash Flood Warning may be needed for this area. This additional rain will result in minor flooding. - Some locations that will experience flooding include... Big Cypress National Preserve, Loop Road Ee Center and Everglades National Park. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Please report observed flooding to local emergency services or law enforcement and request they pass this information to the National Weather Service when you can do so safely.
